title: No module file generated for package petsc and slepc
body:
## Basic info

Spack version: head of develop branch.
OS version: Ubuntu 18.04 server.

Install commands and specs for the two packages:
`spack install petsc@3.11.0  ^intel-parallel-studio`, 
`spack  install slepc ~arpack ^intel-parallel-studio ^petsc@3.11.0`.

 Besides, I use lmod as module tools, which is given by `spack install lmod`. And all other packages can generate module files as expect, the module system works well, too. 

```bash
$ spack config get modules
modules:
  enable:
  - tcl
  - dotkit
  prefix_inspections:
    bin:
    - PATH
    man:
    - MANPATH
    share/man:
    - MANPATH
    share/aclocal:
    - ACLOCAL_PATH
    lib:
    - LD_LIBRARY_PATH
    - LIBRARY_PATH
    lib64:
    - LD_LIBRARY_PATH
    - LIBRARY_PATH
    include:
    - CPATH
    lib/pkgconfig:
    - PKG_CONFIG_PATH
    lib64/pkgconfig:
    - PKG_CONFIG_PATH
    ? ''
    : - CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH
  lmod:
    hierarchy:
    - mpi
    verbose: false
    hash_length: 7
    whitelist: []
    blacklist: []
    blacklist_implicits: false
    all:
      conflict: []
      environment:
        unset: []
      filter:
        environment_blacklist: []
      load: []
    core_compilers: []
  tcl:
    hash_length: 2
    all:
      suffixes:
        ^python@3.6.5: py3
        ^python@2.7: py2
        ^openblas: openblas
        ^openmpi: ompi
        ^intelmpi: impi
      filter:
        environment_blacklist: []
      conflict: []
      load: []
      environment:
        unset: []
    intel-parallel-studio:
      filter:
        environment_blacklist:
        - PS1
      conflict: []
      load: []
      environment:
        unset: []
    verbose: false
    whitelist: []
    blacklist: []
    blacklist_implicits: false
```
## Error message

```bash
# for other packages installed
$ spack load python@3
# succeed
$ spack load petsc
==> Error: Even though petsc@3.11.0%gcc@7.4.0~X clanguage=C ~complex~debug+double~fftw+hdf5+hypre~int64~knl+metis+mpi~mumps patches=8376e284d251c7c3c550609980c1503c52f68478447860b57e463433592e580f +shared~suite-sparse+superlu-dist~trilinos arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 ^hdf5@1.10.5%gcc@7.4.0~cxx~debug+fortran+hl+mpi+pic+shared~szip~threadsafe arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 ^hypre@2.15.1%gcc@7.4.0~debug~int64~internal-superlu+mpi+shared~superlu-dist arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 ^intel-parallel-studio@2019%gcc@7.4.0~advisor~clck+daal~gdb~ilp64~inspector+ipp~itac+mkl+mpi~newdtags+rpath+shared+tbb threads=none ~vtune arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 ^metis@5.1.0%gcc@7.4.0 build_type=Release ~gdb~int64 patches=4991da938c1d3a1d3dea78e49bbebecba00273f98df2a656e38b83d55b281da1,b1225da886605ea558db7ac08dd8054742ea5afe5ed61ad4d0fe7a495b1270d2 ~real64+shared arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 ^numactl@2.0.12%gcc@7.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 ^parmetis@4.0.3%gcc@7.4.0 build_type=RelWithDebInfo ~gdb patches=4f892531eb0a807eb1b82e683a416d3e35154a455274cf9b162fb02054d11a5b,50ed2081bc939269689789942067c58b3e522c269269a430d5d34c00edbc5870,704b84f7c7444d4372cb59cca6e1209df4ef3b033bc4ee3cf50f369bce972a9d +shared arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 ^superlu-dist@6.1.1%gcc@7.4.0 build_type=RelWithDebInfo ~int64+shared arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@7.4.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-x86_64 is installed, no tcl module has been generated for it.
```
It complained that although petsc is installed, no tcl module has been generated for it. And similar things happened for slepc.

I don't know whether it was by design for these two packages or a bug.
